intro: Cordylocarpus tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cordylocarpus, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
